newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan says reports say N.Korea deployed missiles.
newsitem.headline: Japan says reports say N.Korea deployed missiles.

text.p: Japanese Foreign Minister Yukihiko Ikeda said on Monday there were unconfirmed reports that North Korea had deployed Rodong-1 ballistic missiles with a range of more than 1,000 km (625 miles).

"It is not that we confirmed this," Ikeda told parliament, "but there are reports that (North Korea) has developed missiles with a range of more than 1,000 km (625 miles). There are certain reports that some of them have been deployed."
Asked if the United States had provided the information, Ikeda said he would refrain from citing the source.

It was the first time a Japanese government official has spoken of the possibility that North Korea has deployed Rodong-1 ballistic missiles, which are believed to be able to hit almost any target in Japan.

In its "Military Balance 1996-1997", published in October 1996, the London-based Institute of International Strategic Studies (IISS) said North Korea was moving to deploy the Rodong-1 missiles in late 1996 or early 1997.
In May 1993, North Korea shocked Japan by test-firing the Rodong-1 into the Sea of Japan just off its coast.
